events.name: GDG DevFest Southern Africa

venue.name: B2C Coworking
venue.address_1: Cnr Jason Moyo Ave and First Street, Harare, Zimbabwe

events.description: GDG Devfest Southern Africa aims to be a full day tech festival focused on talks with hands on learning of the latest technologies in Android, VR, Web, Machine Learning, tech entrepreneurship and the future of technology in Africa. It aims to bring together a diverse mix of developers, designers, entrepreneurs and tech enthusiasts from around Southern Africa to share and learn the knowledge they have acquired with the rest of the community. We will host a two track focused event, one on code labs and the other on technical talks along with having industry professionals gracing the event.

events.name: Certify your web development skills with Google

venue.name: B2C Coworking
venue.address_1: Cnr Jason Moyo Ave and First Street, Harare, Zimbabwe

events.description:
• What we'll do
The Mobile Sites certification assessment is designed to test your knowledge of mobile website development. You'll need to pass the Mobile Sites assessment to become certified in Mobile Sites.

The assessment is designed to test your knowledge of basic and advanced mobile website concepts, including the following:
* Value proposition of mobile websites
* How to improve mobile website speed
* How to create an effective user experience for mobile websites
* Introduction to advanced web technologies

• What to bring
laptop

• Important to know
This certification is for people with an understanding of web development

events.name: Women Techmakers Harare Launch

venue.name: B2C Coworking
venue.address_1: Cnr Jason Moyo Ave and First Street, Harare, Zimbabwe

events.description: Women techmakers is a supportive global community in which women can connect, be inspired, and encourage each other to realize their passions. We showcase the work and passions of women in the technology industry by providing a platform to celebrate their talents and spotlight role models.

events.name: Google I/O Extended Harare

venue.name: B2C Coworking
venue.address_1: Cnr Jason Moyo Ave and First Street, Harare, Zimbabwe

events.description: A place to HAVE FUN, explore the Fourth Industrial Revolution and hear what's new on Google's technology stack - Topics will include Virtual Reality, Artificial Intelligence and the Cloud among others. Content and talks will be beginner level so everyone is welcome.

events.name: DevFest Zimbabwe 2018

venue.name: B2C Coworking
venue.address_1: Cnr Jason Moyo Ave and First Street, Harare, Zimbabwe

events.description:
GDG Devfest Zimbabwe is an event hosted by GDG Harare and Women Techmakers Harare that will run on the 26th of October 2018. We have an amazing Devfest Conference day planned with talks focused on the latest technologies in Machine Learning, Game Development, Angular and Business Strategy. We are excited to announce that our Keynote Speaker will be Dr. Panashe of the High Performance Centre. We are excited about tech entrepreneurship and the future of technology in Africa.

The festival aims to bring together a diverse mix of developers, designers, entrepreneurs and tech enthusiasts from around the country to share and learn the knowledge they have acquired with the rest of the community.

events.name: A fresh start

venue.name: B2C Coworking
venue.address_1: Cnr Jason Moyo Ave and First Street, Harare, Zimbabwe

events.description:
First meetup of the year.

We will be hosting Clive Savanhu, the Director of Operations and Norest Shenje, the Director of Technology from Science Programming & Uncommon Technologies (SPROUT). SPROUT is a non-profit organization aimed at democratising access to STEM and leveraging the power of technology to create educational and economic opportunities for all Zimbabweans, particularly those from marginalized or disenfranchised demographics.

And Rushmore Mushambi, Co-Founder and CEO, Web Enchanter (Private) Limited. Who will be exploring the trend towards compiled languages and introducing modern compiled languages as he shares his experience in the world of software development.

We're also going to do a call for sessions, facilitators and volunteers who would like to join our team.
